t: The main male and female speakers (identified primarily on the basis of the gender of the relevant Hebrew forms) are indicated by the captions He*i and She*i respectively. The words of others are marked Friends.*i In some instances the divisions and their captions are debatable.
1:4*r The Hebrew is masculine singular.
1:5*r Or Salma*i
Or He*i
2:1*r Probably a member of the crocus family
2:3*r Or possibly apricot*i ; here and elsewhere in Song of Songs
2:17*r Or the*i hills*i of*i Bether*i
3:10,11*r Or interior*i lovingly*i inlaid*i /*i by*i the*i daughters*i of*i Jerusalem.*i /*i Come*i out,*i you*i daughters*i of*i Zion,*i /*i and*i look*i
4:4*r The meaning of the Hebrew for this phrase is uncertain.
4:15*r Or I*i am*i (spoken by She*i )
5:6*r Or heart*i had*i gone*i out*i to*i him*i when*i he*i spoke*i
6:12*r Or among*i the*i chariots*i of*i Amminadab*i ; or among*i the*i chariots*i of*i the*i people*i of*i the*i prince*i
6:13*r In Hebrew texts this verse (6:13) is numbered 7:1.
In Hebrew texts 7:1-13 is numbered 7:2-14.
7:9*r Septuagint, Aquila, Vulgate and Syriac; Hebrew lips*i of*i sleepers*i
7:11*r Or the*i henna*i bushes*i
8:6*r Or ardor*i
8:6*r Or fire,*i /*i like*i the*i very*i flame*i of*i the*i Lord*i
8:7*r Or he*i
8:11*r That is, about 25 pounds or about 12 kilograms; also in verse 12
8:12*r That is, about 5 pounds or about 2.3 kilograms
